software.description:
We derived the first set of normative functional brain atlases for infants (neonates, 1- and 2-year olds) by parcellating the infant brain into functionally homogeneous regions based on a novel hybrid iterative normalized cut approach. Infant-specific structural (i.e., AAL) atlases were used as spatial constraint.

Please refer to the following article for the atlases:
Feng Shi, Andrew P. Salzwedel, Weili Lin, John H. Gilmore, Wei Gao, "Functional Brain Parcellations of the Infant Brain and the Associated Developmental Trends", Cerebral Cortex, 2017. https://doi.org/10.1093/cercor/bhx062
